channel.title: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
channel.description: I wasn't sure if there was a certain way of getting pistons to work in a /res? I was trying to make a "secret"door using sticky pistons, but the pistons aren't working. Outside of the /res, they work fine though...

item.title: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
item.dc:creator: @TheCowfishy TheCowfishy
item.description:
@TheCowfishy wrote:

I wasn’t advertising, simply stating the server I was on in order to give a better idea of the circumstances, thus creating a more suitable description for someone to aid me in solving.

Read full topic
item.source: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?

item.title: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:18, topic:446280”][quote author=TheCowfishy link=topic=549143.msg4028709#msg4028709 date=1340559917]
Nope. I believe that I already mentioned that this was all on server.mdynamics.tk
[/quote]please keep the advertisement to the advertising section.[/quote]The server needs identifying somehow. Though I think it would have been more appropriate to run the address through a hash function. That way anyone that already knows of the server can correctly identify it, and anyone who doesn’t know of it can deduct that he’s not talking about moparcraft.

Read full topic

item.title: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
item.dc:creator: @TheCowfishy TheCowfishy
item.description:
@TheCowfishy wrote:

With the jobs plugin (hunter), and my pvp skills, it adds up to enough to make around 30 d-blocks per day. Keep in mind that efficiency is key here. Also, I buy diamonds for 20 a piece, so thats 180 a block, and I can accumulate up to 5000 a day, if i dedicate myself.

Read full topic

I never claimed to have mines. I buy and trade for my diamonds, plain and simple.
Who is this xray?[/quote]

item.source: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?

item.title: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
item.dc:creator: @TheCowfishy TheCowfishy
item.description:
@TheCowfishy wrote:

I was trying to rig it so that there was a pressure plate on the roof of my house that was reached via ladder in the back of the house. When stepped on, it used delayers to give about 5 seconds to drop down and go through the door. Before opening, it simply appeared as an inconspicuous diamond block, as the rest of my home was built using d-blocks. I have quadruple-checked the circuitry, and even gotten outside advise, and STILL the pistons wont operate…

Read full topic
item.source: Pistons dont work in /res when using Bukkit?
